Heinrich Rombach (1923-2004) was the perhaps most influential German philosopher of the 20th century.  Following the Freiburg tradition of Husserl and Heidegger he ushered phenomenology into a new dimension of thought through his concept of structure.

The torrent contains four of his major works in German.  To my knowledge, there are no translations available as yet, however, further works and an introduction in English will follow.
